intro: Chaetacanthus hispidus, commonly known as the rough-hairy spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and showy, often brightly colored inflorescences. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are usually hairy and lobed, while the stems are often rough to the touch. Despite its ornamental appeal, it contains toxic compounds and should be handled with care.
